intro: Sphinctacanthus malayanus, commonly known as the Malayan sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, with four petals and stamens. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain water in its native habitat. Sphinctacanthus malayanus is often found growing in rocky crevices or along stream banks, showcasing its preference for well-drained soils.
